ratings.comment: The way concepts were taught were difficult to understand, but he is a really nice guy who will definitely help you during office hours. He's very sympathetic as well, and he understands when students have problems come up. 80% of your grade is based on exams, but I found them to be really fair.

no surprises on the exams, they're the same as the what it's in lecture, hw's and discussion problems. PAY ATTENTION IN LECTURE, no matter how boring it is. There is no textbook so all you get is what he says. He does upload answers to the lecture notes, but barely shows any work. Discussions aren't necessary.
If you pay attention in lecture and do the homework/discussion questions, you will be fine.
Very easy class, there are no surprises come the exam as it's exactly what you do in lecture. He has a cool jacket.

Go to lectures, because most of what is on his exams are practice problems straight from lectures. Can't really understand him because of his accent, and discussions are pretty useless. Exams are pretty hard, but he gives lots of study materials. Not a bad guy, just not an interesting class.

Not really a great professor. His accent can make it hard to understand stuff and most of my understanding of the material came from figuring it out on my own. Exams can be pretty rough, but the curves he creates for exams are bizarre (could get 4 points below average and get an A) and usually work in favor of students.
